FuncDef:
The host-packet send service-class te enable command configures a device to send host packets over a TE tunnel with the highest priority.
The undo host-packet send service-class te enable command cancels the configuration.
By default, a device sends host packets over a TE tunnel randomly selected.
CLIs: undo host-packet send service-class te enable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a device is configured with multiple TE tunnels with varying priorities, the device by default randomly selects a TE tunnel in load balancing mode to send host packets. To configure the device to send host packets over the TE tunnel with the highest priority, run the host-packet send service-class te enable command.
